intro: Hieracium densicapillum, commonly known as the dense-capped hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy basal rosette. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, pastures, and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped, hairy, and often have a reddish or purple underside. The flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in dense clusters, giving the plant its common name.
